cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend today and then race NE just offshore of the southeastern U.S. coast before moving well out into the open Atlantic south of New England
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – storm remains well offshore of Boston

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch areas discontinued; none posted north of South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Indian Pass to Englewood FL and from Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeastern Georgia, and the Atlantic coasts of Florida and the Carolinas
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Boston not listed in probability table – cumulative probability <3%)
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions possible as the storm passes several hundred miles SE of New England
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Massachusetts coast
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall expected; any precipitation would be light and frontal in nature
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk mid-week along New England beaches
